com.shelbot.blocks

Class Block

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.shelbot.blocks.Block
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Daddy

    public abstract class Block
extends java.lang.Object
    This class models a Block. It can be used in the ProgrammingWindow to have drag and drop programming with Processing PApplet.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Block.BlockType
      Defines the type of block the block is
      static class  Block.Location
      Defines the location of the block when near another block
      static class  Block.ParamType
      Defines the type of paramater the block has
      static class  Block.SecondaryBlock
      Defines the hierarchy status of th of paramater the block has
      class  Block.ShadowBlock
      This class models a ShadowBlock.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Block(float x, float y, java.awt.Color color, java.lang.String text, java.lang.String params, boolean isFirstBlock, boolean isLastBlock, Block.BlockType blockType, Block.ParamType paramType, Block.SecondaryBlock secondary)
      Creates a new instance of a Block object with a starting x and y coordinate, a Color for the block (based on category), the text representing the block, the input that will act as parameters for the block, whether the block is for starting or ending, the type of block it is, the parameter type it will take in, and the block's heirarchy.

      • blockWidth

    • Constructor Detail

      • Block

        public Block(float x,
             float y,
             java.awt.Color color,
             java.lang.String text,
             java.lang.String params,
             boolean isFirstBlock,
             boolean isLastBlock,
             Block.BlockType blockType,
             Block.ParamType paramType,
             Block.SecondaryBlock secondary)
        Creates a new instance of a Block object with a starting x and y coordinate, a Color for the block (based on category), the text representing the block, the input that will act as parameters for the block, whether the block is for starting or ending, the type of block it is, the parameter type it will take in, and the block's heirarchy.
        Parameters:
        x - main x-coordinate of the block
        y - main y-coordinate of the block
        color - the color the block will be filled with
        text - states what the block does
        params - the input given into the block from the user
        isFirstBlock - defines whether the block is the first block in script
        isLastBlock - defines whether the block is the last block in script
        blockType - the block type that will be drawn
        paramType - the parameter type of the block
        secondary - the hierarchy stance of the block (includes control blocks)
